name: df-clwwlkn
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cclwwlkn, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, universe, crab(s2, cfv(cclwwlk, cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s2)), cv(s0)))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ ClWWalksN =(s0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà(ClWWalks ` s1)|(# ` s2)= s0 })
comment: Define the set of all closed walks of a fixed length ` n ` as words over the set of vertices in a graph ` g ` . If ` 0 < n ` , such a word corresponds to the sequence p(0) p(1) ... p(n-1) of the vertices in a closed walk p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0) as defined in ~ df-clwlks . For ` n = 0 ` , the set is empty, see ~ clwwlkn0 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2022.)
